00022 /**
00023  * @file   DataStore
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Oct  2 11:29:47 PDT 2009
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for encapsulating microarray data and storing it on disk in a
00028  * reasonable way to reduce memory impact. Key idea is to reorganize the data on
00029  * disk in the order which it will be used by the application to avoid lots of
00030  * seeks. Hopefully with a small number of seeks the performance impact of
00031  * on-disk stoarage will be minimal. Similar to DiskIntensityMart in spirit but
00032  * with a couple other features like reorganizing. Ability to serialize out all
00033  * data including the map and probe ids is also important.
00034  *
00035  * Open questions: 
00036  * - Can be generalized to support formats like a summarized probesets or other
00037  *   data that is now in chp files?
00038  * - Support generic sorting for things like chromosome order, or probeset order
00039  *   or chip order for blemishs
00040  */
00041 
00042 #ifndef _DATASTORE_H_
00043 #define _DATASTORE_H_
00044 
00045 class DataStore;
00046

00082 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;

00085 /**
00086  * Class that stores data about probes and probesets out of core but loads into
00087  * RAM as necessary for computation. By ordering data on disk in the same order
00088  * as processing occurs a large decrease in RAM usage can be obtained with minimal
00089  * impact in performance times.
00090  *
00091  * Currently this class is a 'write once' type affair. It is not recommended to try
00092  * resorting or reuse an existing object.
00093  */
00094 class DataStore : public IntensityMart, public CelListener {
00095 
00096 private :
00097 
00098   /**
00099    * Types of probe data that the store can hold
00100    */
00101   enum ProbeColumns {
00102     ProbeGc,
00103     ProbeGcBgrd,
00104     ProbePm,
00105     ProbeMm,
00106     ProbePmMm,
00107     ProbeInProbeset,
00108     ProbePmAlleleMatch,
00109     // Insert new probe annotations here
00110     ProbeLastEnum,
00111   };
00112                                                
00113 public :
00114 
00115   /** 
00116    * Constructor.
00117    */
00118   DataStore();
00119 
00120   /** 
00121    * Constructor allowing specification of temporary file to be used
00122    * 
00123    * @param fileLocation - Path to file location to be used.
00124    */
00125   DataStore(const std::string &fileLocation);
00126 
00127   /** 
00128    * Destructor
00129    */
00130   ~DataStore();

00137   void initFromFile(const std::string &fileLocation);

00143    */
00144   void initFromDataStore(const DataStore &ds);

00147    * Get the order that the probes are currently stored in.

00150   const std::vector<int> &getProbeOrder() const;

00156    */
00157   void setProbeOrder(const std::vector<int> &order);

00170    * @param celFiles - Vector of paths to cel files to be read.
00171    */
00172   void slurpDataFromCelFiles(const std::vector<std::string> &celFiles);
00173 
00174   /** 
00175    * Given a chip and a channel calculate the the correct column of our data matrix.
00176    * Data is stored interleaved so chip 0 channel 0 is column 0 and chip 0 channel 1 is 
00177    * column 1, etc. 
00178    * 
00179    * @param chipIx - What cel file of data is being queried
00180    * @param channelIx - What channel of that cel file is desired
00181    * 
00182    * @return - correcto column  of our data matrix to get the data.
00183    */
00184   int getDataSetIx(int chipIx, int channelIx) const;
00185 
00186   /** 
00187    * Given an data set index return the cel file name that it comes from. For
00188    * example if the cel files have 2 channels and you ask for the cel name for
00189    * dataSetIx = 1 or dataSetIx = 2 you'll get the same name.
00190    * 
00191    * @param dataSetIx - What cel file of data is being queried
00192    * 
00193    * @return - string name of cel file containing that data set index
00194    */
00195   std::string getCelName(int dataSetIx) const;
00196   
00197   /** 
00198    * @brief Given the probe index and chip index return the intensity
00199    * data appropriate for that probe in that chip. Depending on the
00200    * object that intensity may have been modified from the original
00201    * found on the chip.
00202    * 
00203    * @param probeIx - Probe Index number.
00204    * @param chipIx - Chip Index number.
00205    * 
00206    * @return double - intensity for that position on array.
00207    */
00208   virtual float getProbeIntensity(probeid_t probeIx, chipid_t chipIx, unsigned int channelIx = 0) const;
00209 
00210   /** 
00211    * @brief Given the probe index and chip index return the intensity
00212    * data appropriate for that probe in that chip. Depending on the
00213    * object that intensity may have been modified from the original
00214    * found on the chip.
00215    * 
00216    * @param probeIx - Probe Index number.
00217    * @param chipIx - Chip Index number.
00218    * 
00219    * @return double - intensity for that position on array.
00220    */
00221   virtual void setProbeIntensity(float value, probeid_t probeIx, chipid_t chipIx);

00223   /** 
00224    * @brief Return all of the intensities for given chipIx
00225    * @param chipIx - Chip Index number.
00226    * @return data - vector of all intensities in the DataStore for given chipIx.
00227    */
00228   virtual std::vector<float> getCelData(int dataSetIx);
00229 
00230   /** 
00231    * @brief Method for getting vector of intensities in original order in CEL file.
00232    * @param celIx - index of input CEL file
00233    * @param channelIx - index of CEL channel that desired dataSet is on
00234    * @return vector of intensities in CEL file order
00235    */
00236   virtual std::vector<float> getCelData(chipid_t celIx,
00237                                         unsigned int channelIx);
00238 
00239   /** 
00240    * @brief Return all of the intensities for given chipIx
00241    * @param chipIx - Chip Index number.
00242    * @return double - vector of all intensities in the DataStore for given chipIx.
00243    */
00244   void fillInCelData(chipid_t chipIx, std::vector<float> &data) const;
00245 
00246   /** 
00247    * @brief Given a vector of data use it to fill in all of the datapoints
00248    * that are going to be needed.
00249    * 
00250    * @param dataName - Name of the vector of data (usually the cel filename).
00251    * @param data - cel file intensity data. 
00252    */
00253   virtual void setProbeIntensity(const int chipIx, const std::vector<float> &data) {
00254     writeColumn(chipIx, m_CelNames[chipIx / m_NumChannels], data);
00255   };

00257   /** 
00258    * @brief Get the names (cel files) for the various data that has been seen.
00259    * @return Reference to all of the filenames.
00260    */
00261   virtual const std::vector<std::string> &getCelFileNames() const { return m_CelNames; };
00262 
00263   /** 
00264    * @brief Get the names (cel files) for the various data that has been seen.
00265    * @return Reference to all of the filenames.

00267   virtual void setCelFileNames(const std::vector<std::string> &names);

00269   /** 
00270    * @brief Get the names (cel files) for the various data that has been seen.
00271    * @return Reference to all of the filenames.
00272    */
00273   virtual const std::vector<std::string> &getCelFileNames() { return m_CelNames; };

00275   /** 
00276    * @brief Get the total number of probes that this mart can supply.
00277    * @return int - total number of probes.
00278    */
00279   virtual size_t getProbeCount() const { return m_OrderProbe.size(); }

00281   /** 
00282    * @brief Get the total number of CEL channels that this mart can supply
00283    * @return int - total number of chips.
00284    */
00285   virtual int getCelDataSetCount() const {  
00286     return m_Chips->getColumnCount(0);
00287   }
00288 
00289   virtual int getChannelCount() const { return m_NumChannels; }
00290 
00291   /** 
00292    * @brief Get the total number of CELs/multi-CELs that this mart can supply
00293    * @return int - total number of chips.
00294    */
00295   virtual int getCelFileCount() const { 
00296     return int(m_CelNames.size());
00297   }
